idea: Navigate with keyboard only.
Test tapping on buttons and menus with your eyes squinted. Are they large enough to hit consistently without precision?
Explore experience for common types of color blindness.
Use a screen reader to navigate. Do all images have appropriate captions. Can you get to all content and every option?
Explore software using voice commands only.
Switch device orientation to ensure standard behavior is matches the expected response for the device platform.
Explore Maximum and Minimum number of characters a user can enter and later retrieve. Compare what you entered against what data is returned to be sure no information is lost.
Explore connectivity loss to ensure helpful and accurate errors appear.
Explore ability to guess username/password repeatedly. Check for enforced password/user name requirements, recovery, and maximum attempts.
Discover maximum continuous uptime by running in an environment as close to production as possible, under typical usage without restarting or performance degradation.
Maximum and minimum window/screen space used.
Tab order, stacking order, layer order, page order, document order, etc.
Drag and Drop between windows, applications, documents, dialogs, and so on.
Special characters like (space * ? / \ | < > , . ( ) [ ] { } ; : ‘ “ ! @ # $ % ^ &) in name or path.
Long name, long path (Values of interest 255, 256, 257, 1000, 1024, 1025, 2000, 2048, 5000, 5001 or more).
Encrypted with or without valid password.
Locked files, files in use, hidden/visible, read write permissions.
Multiple user roles with all levels of access.
Name already exists.
Blank, space in name/path, invalid path due to moved/deleted items.
Revert to past versions or archive old data/restore backup.
Remove machine, cloud hosted, remote drive (present & disconnected).
Corrupted (document, preferences, backups or supporting files & dependencies).
Characters for all languages (Extended character set like àáâãäåçèéêëìíîðñòôõöö, punctuation, extended byte character sets).
Crossing time zones (airplane mode, crossing the data line, going on/offline).
Timeouts are appropriate & can be recoverable when service is restored.
Date/Time validity including no date when a date is required, leap year, always invalid date/time, military time, daylight savings time, different time/date separators and formats.
Clock is invalid. Server clock is wrong, can’t reach server for time.
Math in all inputs including maximum decimals, entering nothing, floating point/decimal, comma delimited decimals.
Large metadata packet. Invalid/unreadable metadata. Sidecar metadata file if relevant. Sidecar link with missing data.
Can print to regionally supported paper sizes in all desired locales.
Copy/Paste, Drag/Drop, Move data between applications and across platforms.
Font types, typographer’s quotes, open type features.
Keyboard from another locale.
Print/Export specific page ranges.
Currency does/doesn’t match the locale.
Spaces (only, beginning, middle, after, non-breaking space).
End or Connecting Characters (Hyphens, page break, line breaks, breaking & non-breaking hyphens).
CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) both with permissions and without permissions to do so.
Automatic saving & reverting to previous versions.
Violate uniqueness (example:username already exists).
Construct a SQL Injection Attack (‘select * from customer).
Run script silently (HTML/SQL/JavaScript Injection.)
Navigate forward/backward, between sections, refresh.
Bookmarks, shortcut, alias, link (create, edit, update) valid and invalid path.
Concurrent users (know how many you should support and what happens if you exceed that) & recovery after the load has been exceeded.
Data from an disallowed origin (Not allowed by CORS, not from same origin).
Many page, tabs, windows, documents, files at once.
Resize (split screen full screen, maximum screen, minimum size, minimize/maximize, switch applications).
Preferences are honored (default and custom), such as Security settings, Font size, window size, custom shortcuts, user contrast settings.
End-to-End workflow: Create a persona, and complete a task from inception through final output in that persona.
Variable analysis, try to change any text or image that seems static.
Alt text, tool tips, help is useful, present, and appropriate to the situation.
Dirty environment (Install as much other software as is possible including old versions of your own and competitor software).
Constrained resources (Low memory, disk almost full, CPU busy, Network slow, packet loss, network down).
Interruptions mid-action (Power outage, log-off, quit, force quit, timeout, cancel, reboot/shutdown).
Selection (Some, Non, All, Insert, Discontiguous).
Flood/Denial of Service.
Explore the sequence of queued requests and race conditions by setting of as many actions as you can at once. Is there a priority order? First in, first out? Maximum number that freezes the queue?
Are context menus  available, useful and the items enabled sensible for the selection.
Search for files, technical help, company and support contact information.
Dependency change (compatible or incompatible versions), availability, crashes are clearly communicated to the user.
Console and Log data is appropriate.
API is read/writable at appropriate levels.
Slow user: Can distracted or otherwise slower customers use your software without interruption?
Battery life is appropriate when the application is active, running in the background, and isn’t being drained when the application doesn’t have permission to run in the background.
Test for memory leaks.
Defaults are appropriate for most users, with a bias to ease of use for newer users.
Undo/Redo all possible actions.
Disaster scenario recovery: Choose a disaster scenario and practice recovering from it.
Explore the last day worth of changes checked in to the codebase.

All characters show correctly in the UI and in multiple fonts, if customizable (example: pygmy judged affordable waffles affianced taffy sticky flicked firmly flight afflicted Website Variegated Affiliated Acquiesced).
Export the smallest possible (file, image, window, data, etc).
Impatient user test: Click through the interface as fast as you possibly can.
Call mode: Actively take/make a phone call, get a text message, while also using your software.
Deny permission to collect data, take photos, and share information.
Scrolling happens at an appropriate speed for the platform.
Explore all supported gestures on the platform and try at different sensitivity settings.
Touch features: Left/Right handed experiences should work equally well. Small vs large hands. Someone with long or short fingernails, with or without nail polish or rings on.
Low battery: 10%, 5% and dead battery.
Discover if crash logs are informative: Cause an intentional crash and read the log file results.
Typical user: Pick the most used platform, version, and features based on any user metrics available.
Reluctant upgrader: Get the oldest version/device/platform still supported.
Clean installation: Install on a system where the user has no previous data.
Upgrade: Make sure user preferences, past settings and files are upgraded.
Beta Testing: Try unreleased operating systems with a focus on new features.
Unsupported hardware/software versions (example: Beta version of iOS).
Cross browser testing: Test every supported browser, and check that unsupported browsers warn the user appropriately.
Copyrights, user agreement is accurate and understandable at all sizes.
Make sure the UI updates when you change a state.
Create a finite state machine map and explore the transitions between states.
Use the share, info, quicklook, and open sith menus to explore the interoperability capabilities of your software.
External hardware (Attach, remove during use, unplug).
Forward migrate old data and make sure everything matches from the past.
Cross platform testing: Move/add/edit/remove data using another platform.
Password Manager: Work with the top 2 most popular password managing applications.
Lock screen: Ensure privacy preferences from the system are honored.
Ad blocker on.
Explore real user content.
Happy User/Sad User: Anything mentioned in the highest and lowest rated reviews, test to tour the most and least popular features.
Notifications are honored and as frequent as the user specified. They are cleared once read following platform standards.
